intro: Stipagrostis subacaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wiregrass, is a perennial grass species native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant typically grows in low, compact clumps and is well adapted to drought conditions. Its flowering stems are short and often bear small, inconspicuous spikelets. Stipagrostis subacaulis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for various desert wildlife.
